kr.ac.kaist.team888.util

Class HangulDecomposer

  • java.lang.Object
    • kr.ac.kaist.team888.util.HangulDecomposer

  • public class HangulDecomposer
extends java.lang.Object
    HangulDecomposer provides decomposing Hangul letter into its characters.

    Available method:

    • decompose(char) : returns a list of characters of given input letter.

    Decomposing Hangul letter is algorithmic and defined in Unicode as normalizing. See Hangul Unicode Normalization for more information about this.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HangulDecomposer() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.ArrayList<HangulCharacter> decompose(char letter)
      Returns an array list of HangulCharacter objects of a given letter by normalizing it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HangulDecomposer

        public HangulDecomposer()

    • Method Detail

      • decompose

        public static java.util.ArrayList<HangulCharacter> decompose(char letter)
        Returns an array list of HangulCharacter objects of a given letter by normalizing it.

        If letter is not a supported Hangul letter, a returned array would contain meaningless values.

        Parameters:
        letter - a Hangul letter to decompose
        Returns:
        an array list of HangulCharacter objects of letter
